question: Plot all points in France where 'pH_CaCl2' > 6 and LC0_Desc is Woodland. Only show mainland France.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter LUCAS data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[(df["Country"] == "France") & (df["pH_CaCl2"] > 6) & (df["LC0_Desc"] == "Woodland")]

# Create GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df.TH_LONG, df.TH_LAT), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load France from 10m shapefile and isolate mainland
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp")
france_full = world[world["NAME"] == "France"].to_crs("EPSG:4326")
france_mainland = france_full.explode(index_parts=True).copy()
france_mainland["area"] = france_mainland.geometry.area
france_mainland = france_mainland.sort_values("area", ascending=False).head(1)

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
france_mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=5)

plt.title("pH_CaCl2 > 6 in French Woodland (mainland only, high-res)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case2_france_mainland_10mplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot all points with LC0_Desc = Woodland across Europe using accurate borders.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["LC0_Desc"] == "Woodland"]

# GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df.TH_LONG, df.TH_LAT), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res shapefile and filter to Europe only
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]

# Compute bounding box of all European woodland points
bbox = gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].total_bounds

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].plot(ax=ax, color="green", markersize=5, label="Woodland")

# Set tight limits around Europe only
ax.set_xlim(bbox[0], bbox[2])
ax.set_ylim(bbox[1], bbox[3])

plt.title("Woodland Points in Europe (High-Res, Zoomed)")
plt.legend()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case3_woodland_europe_zoomedplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Perform KMeans clustering on TH_LAT and TH_LONG across Europe and plot the clusters with borders.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans

# Load and filter LUCAS data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["IsInEurope"] == True]
df = df[["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"]].dropna()
df["TH_LAT"] = pd.to_numeric(df["TH_LAT"], errors="coerce")
df["TH_LONG"] = pd.to_numeric(df["TH_LONG"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna()

# Run KMeans clustering
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=3, random_state=0)
df["cluster"] = kmeans.fit_predict(df[["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"]])

# GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res Europe shape
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="cluster", cmap="tab10", markersize=5, legend=True)

# Zoom to bounding box of points
bbox = gdf.total_bounds
ax.set_xlim(bbox[0], bbox[2])
ax.set_ylim(bbox[1], bbox[3])

plt.title("KMeans Clustering on TH_LAT and TH_LONG (Europe)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case8_kmeans_thlat_long_europeplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot locations in Denmark where 'K' and 'pH_H2O' are above the 75th percentile.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Denmark"]
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["K", "pH_H2O", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])

# Thresholding
k_thresh = df["K"].quantile(0.75)
ph_thresh = df["pH_H2O"].quantile(0.75)
df = df[(df["K"] > k_thresh) & (df["pH_H2O"] > ph_thresh)]

# Convert to GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Denmark mainland shape
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
denmark = world[world["NAME"] == "Denmark"].explode(index_parts=True)
denmark["area"] = denmark.geometry.area
denmark_main = denmark[denmark["area"] > 0.5]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
denmark_main.plot(ax=ax, facecolor="lightgrey", edgecolor="black", linewidth=1)
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=25)

# Use full mainland bounds to frame everything
ax.set_xlim(denmark_main.total_bounds[0] - 0.2, denmark_main.total_bounds[2] + 0.2)
ax.set_ylim(denmark_main.total_bounds[1] - 0.2, denmark_main.total_bounds[3] + 0.2)

ax.set_title("K > 75th % and pH_H2O > 75th % in Denmark")
ax.set_xlabel("Longitude")
ax.set_ylabel("Latitude")
ax.grid(True, linestyle="--", alpha=0.4)

plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plotplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Show land cover types in Germany using LU_DESC on a map.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load LUCAS data and filter for Germany
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Germany"]

# Fallback for LU_DESC
if "LU_DESC" not in df.columns and "LC0_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LU_DESC"] = df["LC0_Desc"]

# Clean
df = df.dropna(subset=["LU_DESC", "TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])

# GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res shapefile and extract Germany
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
germany = world[world["NAME"] == "Germany"]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
germany.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="LU_DESC", cmap="tab10", markersize=5, legend=True)

plt.title("Land Cover Categories in Germany")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case7_land_cover_germany_fixedplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot all points in Europe with 'K' above median. Use only the European mainland.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df = df[df["K"].notna()]
df = df[df["TH_LONG"].notna() & df["TH_LAT"].notna()]
df = df[df["K"] > df["K"].median()]

# Create GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res countries shapefile
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"].explode(index_parts=True)

# Optional: filter out small islands (keep large landmasses only)
europe["area"] = europe.geometry.area
europe_mainland = europe[europe["area"] > 1]  # Keep mainland

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 9))
europe_mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=5, label="K > median")

# Zoom to bounds of points
ax.set_xlim(gdf.total_bounds[0] - 1, gdf.total_bounds[2] + 1)
ax.set_ylim(gdf.total_bounds[1] - 1, gdf.total_bounds[3] + 1)

plt.title("K > Median in Europe (Mainland Only, High-Res)")
plt.legend()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case12_k_above_median_europe_fixedplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot all points in Czechia where 'OC' is above the median and color by LU_DESC.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load LUCAS data and filter for Czechia
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Czechia"]
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")

# Fallback to LC0_Desc if LU_DESC not found
if "LU_DESC" not in df.columns and "LC0_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LU_DESC"] = df["LC0_Desc"]

# Clean and filter
df = df.dropna(subset=["OC", "LU_DESC", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])
df = df[df["OC"] > df["OC"].median()]

# Create GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res country shapefile
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")

# Try both possible names for Czechia
cz_shape = world[world["NAME"].isin(["Czechia", "Czech Republic"])]
if cz_shape.empty:
    raise ValueError("Czechia not found in shapefile. Please check country name in shapefile.")

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
cz_shape.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="LU_DESC", cmap="tab10", markersize=5, legend=True)
ax.set_title("OC > Median in Czechia (colored by LU_DESC)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case6_czechia_oc_ludesc_fixedplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot points in Austria where 'K' > 90th percentile using THU/THUNUS coordinates.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Austria"]
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")

# Fallback logic for coordinates
if "THUNUS" in df.columns and "THU" in df.columns:
    df["X"] = pd.to_numeric(df["THUNUS"], errors="coerce")
    df["Y"] = pd.to_numeric(df["THU"], errors="coerce")
else:
    df["X"] = pd.to_numeric(df["TH_LONG"], errors="coerce")
    df["Y"] = pd.to_numeric(df["TH_LAT"], errors="coerce")

# Drop rows with missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=["X", "Y", "K"])

# Quantile filter
df = df[df["K"] > df["K"].quantile(0.9)]

# GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["X"], df["Y"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load Austria shape (high-res)
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
austria = world[world["NAME"] == "Austria"]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
austria.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=5)
plt.title("K > 90th Percentile in Austria")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case4_k_thunus_austria_fixedplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Perform KMeans clustering on OC and K in Poland and plot the clusters using borders.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans

# Load and filter data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Poland"]
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["OC", "K", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])

# KMeans clustering
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=5, random_state=0)
df["Cluster"] = kmeans.fit_predict(df[["OC", "K"]])

# GeoDataFrame for points
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res world and get Poland
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp")
poland = world[world["NAME"] == "Poland"]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
poland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="Cluster", cmap="tab10", markersize=5, legend=True)

# Zoom to Poland’s polygon bounds
ax.set_xlim(*poland.total_bounds[[0, 2]])
ax.set_ylim(*poland.total_bounds[[1, 3]])

plt.title("KMeans Clustering on OC and K in Poland")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case9_kmeans_oc_k_poland_finalplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot all points in Europe with 'pH_H2O' > 5 in blue, others in red, using full continent map.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and prepare data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["pH_H2O", "TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])

# GeodataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res country borders and clip to Europe
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")

gdf[gdf["pH_H2O"] > 5].plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=5, label="pH_H2O > 5")
gdf[gdf["pH_H2O"] <= 5].plot(ax=ax, color="red", markersize=5, label="pH_H2O ≤ 5")

plt.title("pH_H2O > 5 in Blue, Others in Red (Europe)")
plt.legend()
plt.xlim(-10, 30)
plt.ylim(35, 72)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("case10_phh2o_red_blue_europeplot.png")
plt.show()

question: Create a map showing soil pH_CaCl2 across Europe using a continuous colormap.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df.dropna(subset=["pH_CaCl2", "TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])

# Create GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load European borders
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]

# Get bounding box
bbox = gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].total_bounds

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].plot(ax=ax, column="pH_CaCl2", cmap="viridis", markersize=5, legend=True)

ax.set_xlim(bbox[0], bbox[2])
ax.set_ylim(bbox[1], bbox[3])
ax.set_title("Soil pH (CaCl2) Colored by Value Across Europe")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png")
plt.show()

question: Plot all points in Germany colored by NUTS_2 region, ensuring the legend fits even with many categories.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load and filter data
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Germany") & df["NUTS_2"].notna()]

# Convert to GeoDataFrame
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

# Load high-res Germany shape
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
germany = world[world["NAME"] == "Germany"]

# Unique NUTS_2 codes and color map
nuts2_codes = gdf["NUTS_2"].unique()
colors = plt.cm.tab20.colors * ((len(nuts2_codes) // 20) + 1)

# Plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))
germany.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")

for i, code in enumerate(nuts2_codes):
    subset = gdf[gdf["NUTS_2"] == code]
    subset.plot(ax=ax, color=colors[i], markersize=5, label=code)

# Custom legend outside
ax.legend(title="NUTS_2 Region", bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left", fontsize="small")
ax.set_title("Points in Germany by NUTS_2 Region")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", bbox_inches="tight", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Map locations in Portugal where 'OC' is above the median and LU_DESC is 'Artificial land'.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
if "LU_DESC" not in df.columns and "LC0_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LU_DESC"] = df["LC0_Desc"]
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Portugal") & (df["OC"] > df["OC"].median()) & (df["LU_DESC"] == "Artificial land")]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
portugal = world[world["NAME"] == "Portugal"].explode(index_parts=True)
portugal["area"] = portugal.geometry.area
mainland = portugal.sort_values("area", ascending=False).head(1)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")

if not gdf.empty:
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="red", markersize=25)
    ax.set_xlim(mainland.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)
    ax.set_ylim(mainland.total_bounds[1] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[3] + 0.5)
    ax.set_title("OC > Median & LU_DESC = Artificial land (Mainland Portugal)")
else:
    ax.set_title("No valid data for OC > Median & Artificial land in Portugal")

plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Show all woodland areas in Finland with OC below its national median.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
if "LC0_Desc" not in df.columns and "LandCover" in df.columns:
    df["LC0_Desc"] = df["LandCover"]
df = df[df["Country"] == "Finland"]
median_oc = df["OC"].median()
df = df[(df["OC"] < median_oc) & (df["LC0_Desc"] == "Woodland")]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
finland = world[world["NAME"] == "Finland"].explode(index_parts=True)
finland["area"] = finland.geometry.area
mainland = finland.sort_values("area", ascending=False).head(1)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 9))
mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
if not gdf.empty:
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="green", markersize=5)
    ax.set_xlim(mainland.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)
    ax.set_ylim(mainland.total_bounds[1] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[3] + 0.5)
    ax.set_title("Woodland in Finland with OC < National Median")
else:
    ax.set_title("No Woodland Points in Finland with OC < National Median")

plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Visualize all locations in Ireland where 'pH_CaCl2' is greater than 6 and LC1_Desc is 'Cropland'.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["pH_CaCl2"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_CaCl2"], errors="coerce")
if "LC0_Desc" not in df.columns and "LC1_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LC0_Desc"] = df["LC1_Desc"]
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Ireland") & (df["pH_CaCl2"] > 6) & (df["LC0_Desc"] == "Cropland")]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
ireland = world[world["NAME"] == "Ireland"].explode(index_parts=True)
ireland["area"] = ireland.geometry.area
mainland = ireland.sort_values("area", ascending=False).head(1)

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
if not gdf.empty:
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=5)
    ax.set_xlim(mainland.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)
    ax.set_ylim(mainland.total_bounds[1] - 0.5, mainland.total_bounds[3] + 0.5)
    ax.set_title("pH_CaCl2 > 6 in Irish Croplands")
else:
    ax.set_title("No matching data for Ireland (pH_CaCl2 > 6 & Cropland)")

plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Display a map of European points with OC above 40 and K above 250.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df = df[(df["OC"] > 40) & (df["K"] > 250)]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG", "OC", "K"])

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"].explode(index_parts=True)
europe["area"] = europe.geometry.area
europe_main = europe[europe["area"] > 1]

valid_countries = europe_main["NAME"].unique()
gdf = gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(valid_countries)]

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe_main.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="red", markersize=5)
bbox = gdf.total_bounds
ax.set_xlim(bbox[0] - 1, bbox[2] + 1)
ax.set_ylim(bbox[1] - 1, bbox[3] + 1)
ax.set_title("European Points with OC > 40 and K > 250")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Plot all samples in the Netherlands where both pH_H2O and OC are above their medians.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Netherlands"]
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["pH_H2O", "OC", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])
ph_median = df["pH_H2O"].median()
oc_median = df["OC"].median()
df = df[(df["pH_H2O"] > ph_median) & (df["OC"] > oc_median)]

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
netherlands = world[world["NAME"] == "Netherlands"].explode(index_parts=True)
netherlands["area"] = netherlands.geometry.area
netherlands_main = netherlands[netherlands["area"] > 0.1]

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
netherlands_main.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="green", markersize=10)
ax.set_title("Samples in Netherlands with pH_H2O & OC > Median")
ax.set_xlim(netherlands_main.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, netherlands_main.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)
ax.set_ylim(netherlands_main.total_bounds[1] - 0.5, netherlands_main.total_bounds[3] + 0.5)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Plot LUCAS points in Europe where LU_DESC is 'Woodland' and pH_H2O is less than 5.5.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
if "LU_DESC" not in df.columns and "LC0_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LU_DESC"] = df["LC0_Desc"]
df = df.dropna(subset=["LU_DESC", "pH_H2O", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])
df = df[(df["LU_DESC"] == "Woodland") & (df["pH_H2O"] < 5.5)]

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]
bbox = gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].total_bounds

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf[gdf["Country"].isin(europe["NAME"])].plot(ax=ax, color="darkgreen", markersize=5, label="Woodland & pH_H2O < 5.5")
ax.set_xlim(bbox[0], bbox[2])
ax.set_ylim(bbox[1], bbox[3])
ax.set_title("Woodland Areas in Europe with pH_H2O < 5.5")
plt.legend()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Show pH_CaCl2 values across Norway, using a color gradient from blue to red.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["pH_CaCl2"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_CaCl2"], errors="coerce")
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Norway") & df["pH_CaCl2"].notna() & df["TH_LAT"].notna() & df["TH_LONG"].notna()]

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
norway = world[world["NAME"] == "Norway"].explode(index_parts=True)
norway["area"] = norway.geometry.area
norway_mainland = norway[norway["area"] > 0.5]

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 10))
norway_mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="pH_CaCl2", cmap="coolwarm", markersize=6, legend=True)
ax.set_xlim(norway_mainland.total_bounds[0] - 1, norway_mainland.total_bounds[2] + 1)
ax.set_ylim(norway_mainland.total_bounds[1] - 1, norway_mainland.total_bounds[3] + 1)
ax.set_title("pH_CaCl2 in Norway (Color Gradient: Blue to Red)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Display Polish points where LC1_Desc is 'Artificial land' and pH_H2O is above 6.5.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
if "LC1_Desc" not in df.columns and "LC0_Desc" in df.columns:
    df["LC1_Desc"] = df["LC0_Desc"]
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Poland") & (df["LC1_Desc"] == "Artificial land") & (df["pH_H2O"] > 6.5)]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
poland = world[world["NAME"] == "Poland"].explode(index_parts=True)
poland["area"] = poland.geometry.area
poland_main = poland[poland["area"] > 1]

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
poland_main.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
if not gdf.empty:
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=6)
    ax.set_title("Artificial Land in Poland with pH_H2O > 6.5")
else:
    ax.set_title("No matching data for Poland (pH_H2O > 6.5 & LC1_Desc = Artificial land)")
ax.set_xlim(poland_main.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, poland_main.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)

plt.tight_layout()

plt.show()

question: Perform KMeans clustering using pH_H2O and OC on samples from Croatia and plot the result.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df = df[df["Country"] == "Croatia"]
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LONG", "TH_LAT", "pH_H2O", "OC"])

X = df[["pH_H2O", "OC"]]
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=3, random_state=42, n_init="auto")
df["cluster"] = kmeans.fit_predict(X)

gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
croatia = world[world["NAME"] == "Croatia"].explode(index_parts=True)
croatia["area"] = croatia.geometry.area
croatia_main = croatia[croatia["area"] > 0.1]

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
croatia_main.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, column="cluster", cmap="tab10", legend=True, markersize=15)
ax.set_title("KMeans Clustering of OC and pH_H2O in Croatia")
ax.set_xlim(croatia_main.total_bounds[0] - 0.3, croatia_main.total_bounds[2] + 0.3)
ax.set_ylim(croatia_main.total_bounds[1] - 0.3, croatia_main.total_bounds[3] + 0.3)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plot.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Plot all locations in Greece where LU_DESC is 'Permanent crops' and OC is above the European median.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["OC"] = pd.to_numeric(df["OC"], errors="coerce")
df = df[df["OC"].notna()]
median_oc = df["OC"].median()
df = df[(df["Country"] == "Greece") & (df["LU1_Desc"] == "Permanent crops") & (df["OC"] > median_oc)]
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df.TH_LONG, df.TH_LAT), crs="EPSG:4326")
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
greece = world[world["NAME"] == "Greece"]
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))
greece.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
if not gdf.empty:
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="red", markersize=20)
    bounds = gdf.total_bounds
    ax.set_xlim(bounds[0] - 0.5, bounds[2] + 0.5)
    ax.set_ylim(bounds[1] - 0.5, bounds[3] + 0.5)
    ax.set_title("Greece: Permanent Crops with OC > European Median")
else:
    ax.set_xlim(greece.total_bounds[0] - 0.5, greece.total_bounds[2] + 0.5)
    ax.set_ylim(greece.total_bounds[1] - 0.5, greece.total_bounds[3] + 0.5)
    ax.set_title("No matching points in Greece (Permanent Crops & OC > European Median)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("test_case_15_greece_final_fixed.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Plot all points in Europe where 'K' is below its median value.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df = df[df["K"].notna() & df["IsInEurope"] == True]
df = df[df["K"] < df["K"].median()]
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG"])
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")
world = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:4326")
europe = world[world["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"].explode(index_parts=True)
europe["area"] = europe.geometry.area
europe_mainland = europe[europe["area"] > 1]
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
europe_mainland.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="purple", markersize=5, label="K < median")
ax.set_xlim(gdf.total_bounds[0] - 1, gdf.total_bounds[2] + 1)
ax.set_ylim(gdf.total_bounds[1] - 1, gdf.total_bounds[3] + 1)
ax.set_title("K Below Median in Europe (Mainland Only)")
plt.legend()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("test_case_12_k_below_median_europe.png", dpi=300)
plt.show()

question: Visualize all locations in Norway where both 'K' and 'pH_H2O' are above their 70th percentile.
code:
```python
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["K"] = pd.to_numeric(df["K"], errors="coerce")
df["pH_H2O"] = pd.to_numeric(df["pH_H2O"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["K", "pH_H2O", "TH_LONG", "TH_LAT"])

k_70 = df["K"].quantile(0.7)
ph_70 = df["pH_H2O"].quantile(0.7)

df = df[(df["Country"] == "Norway") & (df["K"] > k_70) & (df["pH_H2O"] > ph_70)]

if df.empty:
    print("No matching points to plot.")
else:
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"]), crs="EPSG:4326")

    europe = gpd.read_file("natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs("EPSG:3857")
    norway = europe[europe["NAME"] == "Norway"].explode(index_parts=True)
    norway["area"] = norway.geometry.area
    norway_main = norway[norway["area"] > 1]

    gdf = gdf.to_crs("EPSG:3857")

    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))
    norway_main.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, color="blue", markersize=20)

    ax.set_title("Norway: K and pH_H2O above 70th percentile")
    ax.set_xlim(gdf.total_bounds[0] - 20000, gdf.total_bounds[2] + 20000)
    ax.set_ylim(gdf.total_bounds[1] - 20000, gdf.total_bounds[3] + 20000)

    plt.tight_layout()
    plt.savefig("test_case_15_norway_K_pH_above_70th.png", dpi=300)
    plt.show()
```

question: Display the top 15% of Nitrogen (N) values within 200 km of Budapest and color the points by LC0_Desc. Mark Budapest.
code:
import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
from shapely.geometry import Point
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.cm as cm
df = pd.read_csv("LUCAS_with_country_info.csv")
df["N"] = pd.to_numeric(df["N"], errors="coerce")
df = df.dropna(subset=["TH_LAT", "TH_LONG", "N", "LC0_Desc"])
geometry = [Point(xy) for xy in zip(df["TH_LONG"], df["TH_LAT"])]
gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(df, geometry=geometry, crs="EPSG:4326").to_crs(epsg=3035)
budapest = gpd.GeoSeries([Point(19.0402, 47.4979)], crs="EPSG:4326").to_crs(epsg=3035)
buffer = budapest.buffer(200000).iloc[0]
threshold = gdf["N"].quantile(0.85)
gdf_filtered = gdf[(gdf["N"] > threshold) & (gdf.geometry.within(buffer))]
europe = gpd.read_file("../natural_earth_data/ne_10m_admin_0_countries.shp").to_crs(epsg=3035)
europe = europe[europe["CONTINENT"] == "Europe"]
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))
europe.plot(ax=ax, color="white", edgecolor="black")
unique_labels = gdf_filtered["LC0_Desc"].unique()
cmap = cm.get_cmap("tab10", len(unique_labels))
color_dict = {label: cmap(i) for i, label in enumerate(unique_labels)}
colors_list = gdf_filtered["LC0_Desc"].map(color_dict)
gdf_filtered.plot(ax=ax, color=colors_list, markersize=10, marker=".")
for label in unique_labels:
    ax.scatter([], [], color=color_dict[label], label=label)
ax.legend(title="LC0_Desc", loc="lower left")
bounds = gdf_filtered.total_bounds
pad_x = (bounds[2] - bounds[0]) * 0.2
pad_y = (bounds[3] - bounds[1]) * 0.2
ax.set_xlim(bounds[0] - pad_x, bounds[2] + pad_x)
ax.set_ylim(bounds[1] - pad_y, bounds[3] + pad_y)
ax.plot(budapest.geometry.x, budapest.geometry.y, marker="*", color="black", markersize=50)
ax.text(budapest.geometry.x + 10000, budapest.geometry.y + 10000, "Budapest", fontsize=10)
plt.title("Top 15% Nitrogen Near Budapest (200 km), Colored by LC0_Desc")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("plots/plot14.png")
plt.show()
